attributes.action: abandon plans to allow a local minority to force councils and the majority to obey them
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Hazel Blears has announced plans to ensure that should a small minority of local citizens submit petitions with 300 signatures to local councils, then said councils will be legally bound to take action on the petitions' requests.

There are many vested religious and other interests who could easily whip up 300 followers to force councils to adhere to their demands - thus forcing their beliefs on the majority who may not agree with them. A bizarre notion of democracy from Ms. Blears and a dangerous precedent which should not be allowed.

rejection.details:
The minister suggested that councils would be required to respond, not required to take action:
